message: http://www.alphaonelabs.com/psyvision/
Going with the name PsyVision :)
Good call,
It's your baby, after all.
Related patent http://www.freepatentsonline.com/7114259.html
I've been reading up on openGL, so I may understand it to some extent soon
make sure to put air holes around the screen, you're effectively building a pump!
It won't be sealed so the air will pass by the sides.
there will be a thin gap between the screen and the sides

They increased the RedBull creation prize to $10,000 worth of gear.  I want that.  I'm planning on heading to the space today (25 April) to try and help out Psytek.  People should come.  Psytek, what time you at the space?
I could do with some gear. Or gears. Psy, how's the Secret Project going? Is there a channel of communication on these contests I should be checking?
Oh, I thought the deadline was 28 Apr.  It was 24 Apr.  C'est la vie.
POV globe entry: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A3diJzvlrLU
Shazam! I've just pulled my head out of my....
Nice! That's not the one w/TV parts, though; is it? Is that internal projection? Looks good.
I checked the date.  We're entered - http://www.alphaonelabs.com/psyvision-holographic-display-update-5/

I was thinking, you want to put an LED inline with the reed switch, and/or mount one on the moving/screen portion.  I'm thinking it might be helpful to videotape the LED to get an idea of how many RPM the device is doing.
I imagine you can do the same thing by just having a dot on the screen...
Or the Micro Machine Man! What about ball type mouse IR sensors' setup? Sync w/frame rate? Or maybe a sync isn't as P for the OV...
It's going to be dynamic and constantly reading the RPM.  If a reed switch doesn't do it, we have opto end stops that may work.
